details.name: JWT Authentication
evidence: ✅ JWT tokens are signed with a secret key
✅ Secret key uses cryptographically secure random generation (64 bytes)
✅ Secret key is persisted to file system
✅ JWT includes issuer and audience validation

details.name: IP Blocking System
evidence: ✅ Blocked IPs are persisted to storage
✅ IP blocking is checked during authentication

details.name: Token Revocation System
evidence: ✅ Revoked tokens are persisted to storage
✅ Revoked tokens are checked during validation

details.name: Rate Limiting System
evidence: ✅ Per-IP auth rate limiting (10 attempts per 5 minutes)
✅ Rate limits are enforced during authentication
✅ Expired rate limit windows are cleaned up

details.name: Token Management Interface
evidence: ✅ Client info included in token generation

recommendations: Consider using bcrypt or argon2 for any password hashing
Consider adding helmet middleware for additional security headers
Consider CSRF protection for future HTTP endpoints
